comments:
In CDT 2.0.0.41 on Windows.

1. Create a Standard Make Project.
2. Project > properties > C/C++ Make Project
3. Turn off "Use default Build command".
Leave the default "make" still there.  OK.
4. Project > properties > C/C++ Make Project again.

Dialog appears:
Could Not Accept Changes
The currently displayed page contains invalid values.

(Click to Info, then back to C/C++ Make Project pane and you may get a pane 
showing the single offending widget, but changing it does not correct the 
problem.)
It is impossible to recover from this without changing the contents of .project.

(Test ref ADOPT13)

This problem causes the following stack-trace:
